title: Restoration Technician -
description:
**Title:** Remediation / Restoration Field Crew Technician

**FLSA Classification:** Full-Time, Non-Exempt

**Location:** Norwalk, CT

**Pay Rate:** Hourly Rate (Depends on Experience)

**DESCRIPTION**


Do you love helping people through difficult situations? Then, don’t miss your chance to join our franchise as a Restoration / Remediation Technician. As a Restoration/Remediation technician at SERVPRO of Stamford, you will be a part of a team of quality people who focus on excellent service, fairness, and mutual respect.


The Restoration / Remediation technician performs production processes to fulfill the service needs of individual restoration projects and maintains the professional appearance of SERVPRO equipment, as well as an assigned service vehicle. By providing quality, consistent, efficient work, the Restoration technician represents the best in the cleanup and restoration industry. As a valued SERVPRO® franchise employee, you will receive a competitive pay rate, with the opportunity to learn and grow. Training and development programs, including industry specific certifications are available.


In this position, you will be making a difference each and every day. We have a sincere drive toward the goal of helping make fire, water and mold water damage “Like it never even happened®!”


Please Note: Our office is a Pet Friendly Office, there are occasionally dogs in our office!

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES**

**Primary Responsibility and Support**


1. Perform production processes, demolition and other labor intensive tasks;


a. Perform fire, water, and mold damage restoration, extracting standing water, demolition, set-up and take down equipment.


2. Prepare rooms/areas for work activities;


a. Set up staging area and containment for each project.


3. Adhere to safety and risk management guidelines at all times.


4. Communicate with restoration supervisor, other technicians, project manager, officeand management personnel to maintain efficient production processes.


5. Inventory and load the work vehicle with equipment, products, and supplies needed foreach project.


6. Perform end-of-day/end-of-job cleanup and breakdown.


a. Leave jobsite with a clean and orderly appearance.


7. Maintain a clean and organized vehicle and clean equipment appearance.


Other

* Other ad-hoc duties assigned and requested by management.

**Skills/Physical Demands/Competencies:**

* Effective communication with basic math and computer skills; preferred
* IICRC certifications; preferred
* Valid driver’s license; required
* Ability to lift a minimum of 50 pounds regularly, occasionally up to 100 pounds with assistance.
* Ability to climb ladders, work at ceiling heights, work in tight spaces (e.g., crawl spaces, attics)
* Ability to stand and walk for prolonged periods of time.
* Ability to repetitively push/pull/lift/carry objects.
* Ability to work with/around cleaning products.
* Ability to travel locally and out-of-state when necessary.
* Ability to successfully complete a background check subject to applicable law.
* Previous experience cleaning, restoration, general labor or construction industry; preferred
* Ability to respond appropriately and interact positively with customers.
* Must have a professional appearance and great attitude.
* Capable to work in a fast-paced team-oriented environment.
* Bilingual – English/Spanish, a plus

**EDUCATION**

* High school diploma/GED; required

**COMPENSATION & BENEFITS**


We offer competitive pay as well as comprehensive benefits. If you feel that you meet the above criteria and are intrigued by the opportunity to work for a dynamic, fast-paced company, please contact us.

**Benefits & Perks:**

* Weekly Pay Schedule
* PTO/Sick, Vacation & Holiday Paid Time Off
* Health insurance
* 401(k) with company match
* Professional development, on the job training, paid training/certifications assistance

**Schedule:**

* 8+ Hour Day / 40+ Hours Per Week Shift, flexible to work overtime when required
* Monday to Friday (Regular Work Shift) and Saturday availability
* Must be willing to be available for on-call rotation due to our 24-hour emergency services
* Some night and weekend work are required

**WORKING CONDITIONS**


Environment: This position will be in the field on job sites, commercial, and residential properties;

* Not eligible for office, hybrid or remote.

**Ability to commute:**

* Norwalk, CT 06851:


Reliably commute to office/warehouse location (Required)

**Physical Demands:** Work is performed in the field on jobsites; commercial, and residential properties and requires the ability to operate standard equipment. Work that includes moving objects between 50-100 pounds may be required.

**ABOUT SERVPRO**

**History**


SERVPRO of Stamford, serving the Fairfield County (Norwalk, CT) area understands the stress and worry that comes with a fire or water damage and the disruption it causes to your life, home, or business. Our goal is to help minimize the interruption to your life and quickly make it \\Like it never even happened.” SERVPRO of Stamford, serving the Fairfield County (Norwalk, CT) area specializes in the cleanup and restoration of residential and commercial property after a fire, smoke or water damage. SERVPRO of Stamford, serving the Fairfield County (Norwalk, CT) area can also mitigate mold and mildew from your home or business.

**Importance of Community**

Many leaders in our business were born, raised, and have raised families of their own in Fairfield County. Our neighbors are very important to us. With over 35 years we have helped thousands of people and businesses to recover from disaster as quickly as possible.

**Training**

We pride ourselves in being the best in the industry, and the best in the community. That’s why our staff is highly trained in property damage restoration. From initial and ongoing training at SERVPRO’s Franchise Facility for regular IICRC-industry certification, our technicians are equipped with the knowledge and tools to restore your property.

*Each SERVPRO® Franchise is Independently Owned and Operated.*

*All employees of a SERVPRO Franchise are hired by, employed by, and under the sole supervision and control of an independently owned and operated Servpro Franchise.*

At SERVPRO®, you can make a positive difference in people’s lives each and every day! We’re seeking self-motivated, proactive, responsible, and service-oriented teammates to join us in our mission of helping customers in their greatest moments of need by repairing and restoring homes and businesses with an industry-leading level of service.


Pay: $18 - $21 / hour


Benefits:

* Paid time off
* Health insurance
* Dental insurance
* Vision insurance
* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Paid training


Job Type: fulltime


Schedule:

* Monday to Friday
* On call
* Overtime


Education: No education required


Work location: On-site
company_description: Servpro Industries, LLC, is a national leader of fire, water, mold, and other specialty cleanup and restoration services.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
**Summary:** We are seeking an Administrative Assistant to perform various office duties

**Job Title:** **Administrative Assistant**

**Location: New York, NY 10004**

**Target Work Schedule: Monday to Friday 8AM to 5PM**

**Target Duration/End Date:** **September 2026**

**Description of Roles and Responsibilities**:

· Sorting and distributing incoming business unit mail received from Mortgage Banking, including but not limited to opening, time stamping mail, sorting and routing incoming mail using electronic mail folders, recording/logging mail received and tracking reports

**Mandatory/Minimum Qualification, Skills, Experience Requirements**:

Associate or Bachelor's degree preferred. And at least two years of relevant experience

**Qualification, Skills, Experience Requirements**:

· Must have good time management skills

· Detail-oriented, organized

· Able to catch errors/inconsistent/ incomplete work, proofread work

· Able to manage a large volume of electronic files without commingling files

· Must be able to work quickly and accurately

· Able to follow office policy and procedure

· Able to rename PDF files, drag and drop files in folders, copy and paste files into folders, create folders, edit template emails, double checks work, ask questions when clarification is needed

· Must be proficient in Microsoft Word, Adobe PDF, Microsoft Excel, and Microsoft Outlook

· Ability to lift to 50 lbs. repeatedly during mail preparation

· Ability to prepare and maintain standard records and reports

· Ability to understand and carry out oral and written instructions

***(Resume must stand alone in demonstrating qualifications and experience)*** 

**Other Notes:**

1. Resume must stand alone in demonstrating qualifications and experience

2. Please take a moment to review the job details, including qualification requirements, location, duration, and pay rate, before you apply

3. Please complete the screening questions for your application or include a cover letter with more information for us and the hiring team to consider

4. We encourage you to complete the Skills Tests to demonstrate your skills

5. Where required, consider submitting proof of licensure with your application

6. Where applicable, consider including samples or examples of your work that demonstrate your capabilities with your application

7. Where relevant, please include your LinkedIn page, at least 3 professional references, a copy of your diploma or other proof of licensure/professional certifications, and your USC / GC / H4 / H1B. **We do not accept C2C applicants without this information**

8. Your application must have your full legal name and current contact information

9. There may be cases where the hiring team requires two or more professional references with application

10. We partner with companies to offer and deliver projects and solutions to our clients Some positions may be hired through our partners

title: Venture Capital Vice President
description:
HOF Capital is a global multi-stage venture capital (VC) firm that partners with the world's best founders and helps them build generational category-defining technology companies. Since launching its first fund in 2016, the firm has invested in some of the most successful technology startups of the past decade (e.g., SpaceX, OpenAI, Neuralink, Anthropic, xAI, etc.) and achieved top-tier investment performance throughout its history, which has enabled the firm to grow rapidly to $1B+ of assets under management (AUM).


Due to this rapid growth, HOF Capital is seeking an A+ player to join its early-stage VC investment team. This VC Vice President will learn from and work directly with the firm's Partners to execute all aspects of the VC investment & portfolio management process, including sourcing new investment opportunities, conducting due diligence, and providing portfolio companies with post-investment support. If successful, this VC Vice President will have the opportunity to become a long-term member of the firm's investment team with a path to eventually becoming a Partner at the firm.

**Minimum qualifications:**

* 6+ years of relevant work experience.
* Attended a top-tier university.
* Majored in a STEM-related field of study.
* Excellent professional & academic performance.
* Independent thinker with outstanding intellectual & analytical aptitude.
* Extremely capable, disciplined, responsible, hard-working, detail-oriented, conscientious, and self-motivated.
* Strong interpersonal & communication skills.
* Team player with no ego.
* Innate desire to become the best.
* Genuine passion for finding, investing in, & supporting technology startups that have the potential to become generational category-defining companies.

**The ideal candidate should be excited to:**

* Do whatever is needed (including working 80+ hours per week, etc.) to help HOF Capital and its portfolio companies become leaders in their industries.
* Build strong relationships throughout the technology, VC, & startup ecosystem in order to help HOF Capital identify promising new founders & startups as early in their journeys as possible.
* Develop deep domain expertise in the technologies & business models within HOF Capital’s areas of interest (e.g., AI, software, deep tech, etc.).
* Play an important role in evaluating investment opportunities (e.g., leading due diligence meetings with founders, conducting expert calls & reference checks, evaluating products & technologies, researching markets & competition, verifying assumptions & claims, etc.).
* Help HOF Capital's portfolio companies become as successful as possible, no matter what it takes.
* Work with other HOF Capital team members to ensure the success of other firm-wide initiatives.

**Expected compensation range:**

* $240,000 - $300,000 annual base salary.
* Annual discretionary bonus.


HOF Capital is a global multi-stage VC firm that partners with the world's best founders and helps them build generational category-defining technology companies. The firm's current and historical portfolio includes some of the most successful technology startups in the past decade including SpaceX, OpenAI, Neuralink, Anthropic, and xAI. The firm has achieved top-tier investment performance throughout its history, which has enabled it to grow rapidly to $1B+ of assets under management.


Pay: $240000 - $300000 / year

title: Certified Public Preschool Teacher
description:
**Build a brighter future for all children.**

Teaching is more than a job. It’s an opportunity to foster curiosity, creativity and compassion in children—all while helping them develop a lifelong love of learning.

As a Certified Pre-School Teacher at Primrose School of Randolph, you’ll create a fun, safe environment for students to discover new concepts with confidence through multi-sensory learning experiences. Enjoy the freedom to modify lessons in order to meet children where they are in the learning cycle as you help them refine kindergarten readiness skills while nurturing their social, emotional, cognitive, creative and physical development.

**Make a difference every day.**

* Spend your days building genuine relationships with each child.
* Help children learn about language and literacy, science, life skills, and more.
* Work to implement the lesson plans from the research-informed Balanced Learning® curriculum.
* Maintain a well-kept classroom that encourages children to create, explore and make decisions with confidence.
* Discover what works best for each child as you teach them about the world around them.

**Get everything you need to give children everything they need.**

At Primrose School of Randolph you bring the passion, and we’ll give you all the tools and training to be successful.

Classrooms come fully stocked with everything you need, and our supportive Leadership Team works every day to create a safe, healthy environment and a culture where all children and team members can thrive.

And if that’s not enough, just wait until you help a child learn something new and see their face light up with excitement.

**Let’s talk about building a brighter future together.**

title: AVP Corporate Development
description:
We are Athene. At Athene, we are driven to do more. We are a leading retirement services company that issues, reinsures and acquires retirement savings products designed for the increasing number of individuals and institutions seeking to fund retirement needs. We see every day as a new opportunity to measure ourselves against the best - and then we don't stop until we've set the bar even higher. We're ready to help you achieve more.  

Purpose:
The Corporate Development department supports the Company’s growth, primarily through the analysis and acquisition of other insurance companies and blocks of business. The Senior Director is involved in all phases of a transaction process, from initial target identification through bidding, structuring, pricing, contract negotiation and closing. The person in this role will perform diligence, underwriting, pricing evaluation, review of other analytical models, and the management of active and prospective M&A and reinsurance transactions.  

Accountabilities:* Support all phases of a transaction process, from initial target identification through bidding, contract negotiation, closing and post-close refresh
* Develop and /or Support Development of pricing models for each proposed transaction, including due diligence of liability projections, development of capital projections, reflection of asset strategy and other related deal model components
* Analyze due diligence materials including Actuarial appraisals, Confidential Information memoranda, policy forms, Cash Flow Testing memoranda, and insurance liability cash flows; Reconcile modeled reserves and assets backing reserves and bridge adjusted net worth from actuarial appraisals to source financial statements
* Lead the preparation of internal deal documents such as the Transaction Memorandum and materials for the management approval process (Large Case Approval Committee)
* Drive the documentation of internal controls and develop and implement policies and procedures to promote more rigorous transaction review; Support other process improvements which help to improve quality and effectiveness of Corporate Development deliverables
* Manage projects with appropriate oversight, collaborate with other business units, and maintain third party business relationships
* Research and be able to summarize and explain actuarial concepts and regulations; Stay abreast of capital market and insurance industry activities and trends.
* Stay informed of proposed and newly implemented actuarial guidelines, relevant accounting pronouncements, risk-based capital factors, and other key issues which could impact deal valuation
* Work collaboratively with peers and manage or mentor less experienced staff and peer review team work product
* Maintain appropriate levels of confidentiality
* Some travel will be required

  

Qualifications and Experience:* 8+ years of experience in the life insurance or reinsurance industry or investment banking background with significant experience in the financial services / insurance sector
* Ideal candidate will have significant experience with Life and Annuity financial planning and analysis, budgeting, financial modeling, and/or accounting/financial reporting, with mastery of U.S. Statutory, Tax, Bermuda Statutory and U.S. GAAP accounting regimes
* Preferred designations are FSA, CPA or similar designation
* Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Finance or related field
* Strong attention to detail and the ability to prioritize and manage several projects
* Demonstrated leadership qualities and strong written and verbal communication skills
* Advanced user of Microsoft Excel, with the ability to embed good organization and high levels of flexibility and auditability in large projects
* Exhibit dedication to completing tasks thoroughly and on time, including under time pressures and outside normal working hours
* Ability to view “big picture”, understand broad corporate impacts, and focus on company objectives

  


$171,840.00 - $257,760.00 USD Annual *Annual Salary for this role is market competitive. Actual salary for all roles will be based upon geographic location, work experience, education, licensure requirements and/or skill level and will be finalized at the time of offer. Depending on the role, a discretionary bonus plan or variable sales incentive may be included.*
Drive. Discipline. Confidence. Focus. Commitment. Learn more about working at Athene.
Athene is a Military Friendly Employer! Learn more about how we support our Veterans.
Athene celebrates diversity, is committed to inclusion and is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, veteran status or any other status protected by federal, state or local law.

title: Behavior Intervention Specialist MA (Adult Services)
description:
Developmental Disabilities Institute, DDI, is one of the largest providers of care to children and adults with Autism, developmental disabilities and other special needs. DDI has been a part of Long Island for over 50 years serving over 1,500 children and adults with Autism, other developmental disabilities and special needs. DDI provides innovative and expansive services to our population through various educational settings, residential services, day habilitation programs and vocational services.



Salary Range: $50,336-$60,403.20/year


### **Responsibilities**


* Complete screening, initial and annual assessments ensuring paperwork is completed and filed appropriately in each individual’s record
* Conducting functional assessments for the purpose of behavior support planning, design and monitoring (involving observation, interview with staff)
* Author behavior support plans based on positive behavior support
* Implement and monitor ongoing data collection to assess progress of behavior support plan and identify need for referral to Human Rights Committee where applicable
* Observe staff working with individuals to ensure BSP is being followed
* Provide feedback and modeling for staff on implementation of behavior support strategies
* Update monthly statement of objectives (i.e., behavioral goals) by the end of the first week of the following month
* Complete annual assessment, quarterly/semi annual reviews and monthly summaries accurately and in a timely manner
* Coordinate with Speech Language Pathologist the development and implementation of functional communication programs
* Implement and monitor ongoing data collection to assess progress of communication programs
* Ensure consistency between existing communication plan and needs identified in behavior support plan
* Ensure that parent/guardian consent for behavior support plans is obtained annually or following significant change to plan
* Ensure that Human Rights Committee approvals are in place prior to psychotropic medication being begun or increased
* Coordination of review and monitoring usage of SCIP-R
* Attending psychiatry and speech/communication appointments
* Provide inservice training for staff behavior plans, general behavior support methods, individual needs and diagnosis, general orientation classes, etc.
* Attending and participating in staff meetings, IDTs, annual meetings
* Attending Human Rights Committee when needed
* Advocating for medication reductions when appropriate
* Attending departmental meetings with supervisor and peers
* Arranging all formal testing as required
* Demonstrating knowledge of procedures for handling emergencies
* Demonstrating familiarity with state and federal regulations in the psychology, communication, and life safety areas of support.
* Demonstrating knowledge of DDI’s policies on the treatment of problem behavior
* Determines appropriately when to inform/ask supervisor for assistance
* Advances own knowledge of field (reading, attending continuing education opportunities)
* Independently works the hours and times necessary to meet the needs caseload
* Respond to off hour needs of individuals ad programs as necessary (on-call)
* Works and communicates effectively with peers, team, and staff
* Serves as a role model of professional behavior in such areas as dress, interpersonal relations and job performance.

### **Qualifications**


* Masters Degree or current enrollment in a Psychology or Spec Ed Graduate Program
* At least 1 year experience providing behavioral support in DD/ID field preferred


*DDI is committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and employees without regard to actual or perceived race, color, sex, pregnancy, reproductive decision making, gender expression or identity, national origin, disability, military status, creed, religion, age, sexual orientation, marital status, genetic information, status as a victim of domestic violence or any other group protected by federal, state or local law. We are committed to creating a deep sense of belonging and a culture where all applicants and employees feel welcomed, valued and respected. We are people inspired by purpose.*
company_addresses: DDI has locations throughout Suffolk County, LI, NY. Our administrative offices and several of our programs are located in Smithtown, LI, NY.

title: Facilities Associate
description:
**Our Story So Far**


Founded in 1862, FAO Schwarz is one of the oldest and most iconic toy retailers in the world. Frederick August Otto Schwarz dreamed of a marvelous, bountiful emporium full of extraordinary, one-of-a-kind toys from all over the world. His dream became a reality, and as one of America's oldest brands, we have provided this wonder to families for more than 160 years.


**The Job**


The Facilities Associate is responsible for delivering the FAO Schwarz brand to our team and guests by completing thorough housekeeping tasks in line with daily checklists. This part-time role is responsible for ensuring store standards are impeccable throughout the day and maintaining supply levels to fully complete the workload each day.


Reporting to: Facilities Coordinator


**What You'll Do**


* Maintain the cleanliness of all areas within the store and break room areas.
* Address maintenance/equipment issues at point of contact or escalating concerns to Leadership as needed.
* Ensure that all safety standards are upheld by wearing protective equipment when necessary, using products and tools correctly, and following all guidelines concerning mixing potentially hazardous chemicals.
* Daily cleaning of floor; sweeping, mopping and vacuuming.
* Daily cleaning of ceiling, vents and visual props.
* Perform routine cleaning of restrooms throughout the day.
* Perform routine trash removal in store and break room area to trash compactor.
* Dusting and cleaning of all surfaces.
* Maintenance and upkeep of all cleaning equipment, supplies, and products.
* Report all repairs needed and safety issues when encountered on the job.
* Follow all health and safety guidelines.
* Follow all procedures for the use of chemical cleaners and power equipment in order to prevent damage to floors and fixtures.


**What You Have**


* 1+ year experience in a facilities or housekeeping role in a flagship or premium retail environment.
* Capable of lifting up to 50 pounds, and bending, twisting, and standing for long periods of time.
* Knowledge of cleaning chemicals and equipment.
* Excellent communication, collaboration and interpersonal ability.
* Ability to work with pace to achieve workload out of hours and during trading times.
* Flexible availability in line with a Flagship Retail environment across days, evenings and weekends.


This job description should not be construed to contain every function/responsibility that may be required to be performed by this role. Employees are required to perform other related functions as assigned.


*FAO Schwarz is an equal opportunity employer and complies with all applicable federal, state, and local fair employment practices laws.*


*FAO Schwarz strictly prohibits and does not tolerate discrimination against employees, applicants, interns, or any other covered persons, on the basis of age, race, color, religion, creed, national origin including ancestry, ethnicity, sex including pregnancy, gender identity, and transgender status, gender, physical or mental disability, including gender dysphoria and similar gender-related conditions, alienage or citizenship status, military status, including past, current, or prospective service in the uniformed services, genetic information, predisposing genetic characteristics, marital status, partnership status, domestic violence victim status, familial status, actual or perceived sexual orientation, unemployment status, caregiver status, credit history, salary history, or any other category protected by applicable federal, state and local laws, with respect to hiring, promotion, discipline, firing, compensation, benefits, or other terms, conditions or privileges of employment.*

title: Ophthalmic Technician
description:
**\\*\\* $1,000 Sign-On Bonus\\*\\***

  


**A career that changes lives.**



SightMD is a rapidly growing integrated ophthalmic provider group, extending the reach of exceptional eye care to patients across New York, New Jersey, Pennsylvania, and Connecticut. With over 127 eye care providers and the convenience of 60 locations, our commitment to delivering unparalleled services is at the heart of everything we do. As we embark on our mission, we are actively seeking teammates who are eager to contribute to our legacy of eye excellence, a tradition that spans more than 50 years.

  


**Position Summary:**



As an Ophthalmic Technician, you will play a vital role as an assistant to our physicians. You will be cross trained to perform a range of administrative and clinical duties. These duties include preparing the patient to see the physician, preparing examination rooms, performing basic and routine vision screening examinations, administering eye medications, cleaning, and maintaining ophthalmic instruments and assisting physicians during minor surgical and laser procedures.


**Job Duties & Essential Functions:**


* Meet and greet patients, gather medical history, and document findings.
* Perform a comprehensive range of pre-exam and advanced diagnostic tests (e.g., OCT, Fundus photography, visual field testing).
* Educate patients on medications and pre/post-operative care as directed by the physician.
* Assist with contact lens fitting and care instruction.
* Perform refractometry to determine refractive errors and assist with minor surgical procedures.
* Maintain inventory of ophthalmic supplies and instruments.
* Assist with clinical equipment upkeep and cleaning.
* Adhere to all safety protocols.
* Participate in continuing education to maintain best practices.
* Process prescription refills with proper authorization.
* Perform other duties as assigned.


**Required Qualifications:**


* High School diploma or equivalent required
* Excellent written, verbal, and listening skills
* Strong interpersonal, time management, and organizational skills
* Strong customer service skills
* Ability to work a flexible schedule, including weekends
* Ability to stand for long periods of time
* Minimum of one (1) year of experience as an Ophthalmic Technician Assistant or one (1) year of specialized ophthalmic experience.


**Preferred Qualifications:**


* Ophthalmic Scribe Certification (OSC) required or completion within 45 days of hire
* Certified Ophthalmic Assistant (COA) certification preferred or enrolled within twelve (12) months of hire and completion within two (2) years of hire.
* Ophthalmic Scribe Certification (OSC)

  


**Work Schedule:**


* Rotating Schedule – including days, evenings and weekends


**Hourly Pay Rate:**


* $24.50

  


**Benefits:**



We aim to take care of our teammates the same way we take care of our patients. All SightMD employees receive the following benefits:


* Medical/Dental/Vision Insurance
* Prescription Drug Coverage
* Company Paid Term Life Insurance & Long-Term Disability
* Supplemental Insurance Benefits
* Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
* Retirement Plan - 401(k)
* Paid Time Off (PTO)
* Paid Holidays
* Career Development Programs


* ***All benefits are subject to eligibility requirements.***

  


**Equal Employment Opportunity Statement:**



SightMD is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, religion, creed, age, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, familial status, pregnancy, predisposing genetic characteristics, military status, domestic violence victim status, criminal conviction, and all other protected classes under federal, state and local laws.



If you are an individual with a disability and need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application process, or in order to perform the essential functions of a position, please contact People Services at peopleservices@sightgrowthpartners.com

title: Server/Wait Staff
description:
We are a family owned British tea room and bakery that takes great pride in our business. We are looking for friendly, fun, responsible, and flexible people to join our serving team! We are looking to add 2-3 servers to our team.

We are specifically looking for flexible and reliable staff with general availability **Thursdays - Sundays.** 

Tea sessions are: Thursday: 1pm, Friday - Saturday: 11am/1pm/3pm, Sunday: 11am/1pm

***\\*\\*\\*Please DO NOT APPLY if these times do not work with your schedule!!!\\*\\*\\****

Server will likely be scheduled at least 1 day a week in our tea room, in addition to private parties. Some weeks scheduled time may increase. Great for someone looking for a unique and rewarding part time position! There may be opportunity to shift into a full time position as well.

**Our work environment includes:**

* On the job training
* Safe and supportive work environment

**RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Conform to standard food handling and sanitation protocols
* Explain food items to guests in a friendly and clear manner
* Help clear and set tables in between seatings
* Help create a pleasant, relaxing experience for our guests

* Works well in fast paced environment
* Ability to take direction well and in a respectful manner
* Great people skills, friendly and approachable, sense of humor
* Responsible and organized
* Knows how to use an iPad (for our POS system)

If interested, please apply and we will follow up to schedule an in person interview. Thank you!

title: Business Analyst
description:
Job Classification:
Operations - Insurance Operations
At Prudential, we believe talent is key to achieving our vision. When you join Prudential, you’ll unlock a motivating and impactful career – all while growing your skills and advancing your profession at one of the world’s leading financial services institutions!
The Sourcing & Procurement AP Business Analyst is responsible for the daily production tasks related to AP quality assurance oversight and reporting, service level escalations, and system issues, enhancements, and efficiencies. This role includes engagement with all Prudential US business groups and corporate centers. The associate will be a vital member of Prudential’s Global Sourcing & Procurement (GSP) Organization within the Prudential Finance Department. GSP seeks to empower Prudential globally to drive the greatest value by leveraging supplier partnerships – providing its customers with easy access to products and services at the greatest value through business insights, market knowledge, seamless and efficient processes, and professional expertise.
This position is in Newark, NJ. The current employee work arrangement for this position is Hybrid and requires your on-site presence on a recurring basis as determined by your business. Your manager will provide additional details relative to the specific number of days you are expected to be on-site.
What you can expect:
Specific responsibilities for the day-to-day operations include but are not limited to the following:* Perform the AP Services Operations quality assurance monitoring
* Monitor Prudential’s outsourced AP resources’ performance
* Respond to AP expense processing issues and escalations
* Build relationships with business groups, corporate centers, and outsourced associates
* Support User Acceptance Testing for system changes and Business Continuation testing
* Conduct end user training on AP applications
* Create and maintain Standard Operating Procedures
* Compile metrics and other operational statistics
* Assist in special projects, initiatives and ad-hoc report and analysis requests
* Continuously identify process efficiencies and improve effectiveness
* Overtime required during peak periods


What you’ll need:* Bachelor’s degree
* Proven ability to be proactive, work independently and with a team
* Strong problem solving, time management and organizational skills
* Excellent oral and written communication and interpersonal skills to navigate and resolve issues
* Ability to quickly adapt to new technology


It’d be a plus if you had:* Experience working with Oracle Financial Applications, Microsoft Excel, and Word
* Previous experience working in a procurement function


Prudential welcomes all applicants, even if you don't meet every requirement. If your skills align with the role, we encourage you to apply.
At Prudential, you can:
Take charge of your career. We equip and empower our employees to expand their skills and experience by using powerful learning, gigs, and job opportunities. We offer a suite of services such as on demand resources and networking to propel your career forward.
We’re a global organization, full of outstandingly dedicated people who aren’t afraid to think differently, challenge the status quo and take sensible risks along the way. You will enjoy pushing boundaries as we build innovative technology that helps clients, customers and employees live their best lives. You will have access to leadership and learning opportunities and the resources needed to take your career in any direction. We will help you do your best work, offering flexibility, while delivering on our Purpose.
What we offer you:* Market competitive base salaries, with a yearly bonus potential at every level
* Medical, dental, vision, life insurance, disability insurance, Paid Time Off (PTO), and leave of absences, such as parental and military leave
* Retirement plans:
* 401(k) plan with company match (up to 4%)
* Company-funded pension plan
* Wellness Programs to help you achieve your wellbeing goals, including up to $1,600 a year for reimbursement of items purchased to support personal wellbeing needs
* Work/Life Resources to help support topics such as parenting, housing, senior care, finances, pets, legal matters, education, emotional and mental health, and career development.
* Tuition Assistance to help finance traditional college enrollment toward obtaining an approved degree, many accredited certificate programs, and industry designations.
* Employee Stock Purchase Plan: Shares can be purchased at 85% of the lower of two prices (Beginning or End of the purchase period), after one year of service.


Note: Prudential is required by state specific laws to include the salary range for this role when hiring a resident in applicable locations. The salary range for this role is from $62,500.00 to $93,000.00. Specific pricing for the role may vary within the above range based on many factors including geographic location, candidate experience, and skills. Roles may also be eligible for additional compensation and/or benefits. Eligibility to participate in a discretionary annual incentive program is subject to the rules governing the program, whereby an award, if any, depends on various factors including, without limitation, individual and organizational performance. In addition, employees are eligible for standard benefits package including paid time off, medical, dental and retirement.

title: Retail Sales Associate
description:
**About us**

We are professional and agile.

Our work environment includes:

* Modern office setting
* Food provided

**Sales Associate Position Overview:**

The Retail Sales Associate (RSA) thrives in a dynamic and high-energy environment. The RSA is responsible for providing an exceptional customer experience at the retail location by assisting new and existing customers with their unique technology needs and resolving issues. The goal of the RSA is to create an outstanding buying experience for the customer and foster a positive team environment. The RSA should be able to position Total Wireless effectively against competitors in the wireless industry and tailor recommendations to fit customers' needs. As a member of the store team, the RSA will work towards achieving the store's financial and customer service goals.

**Sales Associate Responsibilities:**

* Provide exceptional customer service to individuals visiting the Total Wireless store, including greeting customers, answering phones, and assessing their needs.
* Exceed monthly revenue goals by acquiring new customer accounts, maximizing existing accounts to identify revenue opportunities, and excelling in quality metrics.
* Participate in marketing efforts to solicit new business, including outbound calling, community involvement, outreach programs, and promoting the brand inside and outside the store/retail location.
* Assist with all functions within the retail store in compliance with Total Wireless policies and procedures.
* Work with store management in opening, closing, and operating the retail facility, including cash handling, inventory count, and deposits as governed by operations control standards.
* Complete accurate paperwork and transactions according to company policies and procedures.
* Share customer experiences with the team, including management.
* Ensure the maintenance of store appearance, back room, restrooms, and individual work areas according to retail store standards.
* Assist with other tasks, duties, or projects as assigned by management.
* Assist customers with service activations, changes, bill payments, responding to billing inquiries, equipment replacement, selling accessories, and processing price plan changes and upgrades.
* Maintain store appearance, inventory counts, and merchandising standards.
* Build customer confidence by making their experience comfortable, simple, and resolving their issues.
* Engage in service selling and right-fit the customer with the appropriate Total Wireless solution.

**Sales Associate Position Requirements:**

* At least 6 months of experience in retail or another environment with a strong sales focus.
* Professional, energetic, and positive attitude.
* Ability to analyze results, plan for the future, make informed decisions, and take responsibility.
* Excellent written and verbal/interpersonal communication skills.
* Flexible scheduling availability and reliable transportation.
* High school diploma or GED.
* Flexible schedule availability (part-time/full-time).
* Working knowledge of cellular, paging, PCS, and advanced wireless communication preferred.
* Bilingual in Spanish and English preferred.
* Must be able to stand for long periods of time (up to 9 hours) on the sales floor.
* Must be able to move and/or lift up to 25 pounds.

**Job Types:** Full-time, Part-time

**Pay:** $15.30 - $17.00 per hour

**Benefits:**

* Employee discount

**Shift:**

* 10-hour shift
* 8-hour shift

**Experience:**

* Sales: 1 year (Required)
* Customer service: 1 year (Required)

**Language:**

* Spanish (Required)
* Portuguese (Preferred)

**Work Location:** In-person

title: Investment Vice President, International Portfolio Management
description:
Job Classification:
Investment Management - Investments
Global Portfolio Management (GPM), a team within Prudential’s CIO Organization, is responsible for coordinating and overseeing all aspects of portfolio management for Prudential’s international insurance businesses, including asset/ liability management and portfolio construction.
GPM’s scope of responsibility includes wholly-owned entities in Brazil and Mexico, as well as strategic investments in Africa and influence oversight and support to Prudential’s JV in South East Asia and China. Latin America businesses require specific coverage to ensure the appropriate investment strategies are developed and executed aligned with ALM best practices. In addition, an appropriate product development support is required to guarantee all investment assumptions are aligned with Prudential asset allocation best practices. Prudential International Insurance (PII) relies in GPM’s investment expertise to assess all M&A opportunities
This Newark-based position will focus on Prudential’s wholly-owned, strategic investments in Africa and support China’s Joint Venture entities and report to the Investment Senior Vice President, Emerging Markets Senior Investment Officer. The position will contribute to a team that directly supports the Head of Global Portfolio Management.
The current employee work arrangement for this position is Hybrid and requires your on-site presence on a reoccurring basis as determined by your business. Your manager will provide additional details relative to the specific number of days you are expected to be on-site.
What you can expect:* Investment policy coordination and oversight for Prudential's international insurance operations.
	+ Collaborate with local investment officers in the development of appropriate portfolio investment policies. Ensure consistency and application of best practices across PII operations.
* Collaborate with local investment teams on portfolio management/investment issues:
	+ Asset/liability management and portfolio construction (SAA).
	+ Product hedging requirements and related pricing considerations.
	+ Define Marginal Asset Allocation (MAA).
	+ Assess the feasibility of new asset classes according to Prudential’s risk appetite framework and best practices.
	+ Analytic and implementation support for new investment initiatives or transactions. Review and selection of asset managers
* Enterprise and cross-functional coordination in addressing issues and enhancing policies and processes on behalf of the IPM organization, including, Corporate oversight function and other International Insurance functional areas.
* Development of portfolio analytics and reporting capabilities.
	+ Lead and coordinate with local investment teams, Finance, Actuarial, Risk Management, Investment Systems, and other stakeholders in the development of portfolio analytics and reporting capabilities.
* Ensure an appropriate governance process and streamlined communication in all investment-related matters back to Prudential
* Support, facilitate and influence our wholly-owned, strategic investments and Joint Venture entities to establish an effective governance framework aligned with Prudential Operating Principles, including IPS and local Investment Committees.
* Support all M&A transactions by conducting all due diligence required for all investment-related purposes
* Participate as part of the CIO Community contributing in wider dialogue with peers to assess relative value ideas, tactical investment opportunities and other relevant portfolio management initiatives.
* Other duties as assigned.


What you'll need:
The ideal candidate will have 10-12 years of relevant asset liability management, portfolio management, and business specific experience managing large insurance investment portfolios and teams of investment professionals.* A strong investment background, with experience of having worked in/with the Latin American markets.
* Solid capital markets perspective, a strong working knowledge of varying liability structures, and a well-formed macro view are vital.
* Strong interpersonal skills, strong influence, clear communication skills, team orientation, and the desire and ability to work with business partners of different national, cultural, and language backgrounds.
* Experience managing and leading talent is required.
* Strong analytic and quantitative skills, and a deep understanding of capital markets with an emphasis on fixed income, FX, and related derivatives markets.
* Knowledge of insurance liabilities, international insurance markets, and regulatory capital frameworks is important.
* Have the desire and ability to work with business partners of different national, cultural, and language backgrounds.


It’d be a plus if you had:* Spanish and/or Portuguese language skills a plus.
* A CFA and MBA/MS in Finance is preferred.


At Prudential, you can:
Take charge of your career. We equip and empower our employees to expand their skills and experience by using powerful learning, gigs, and job opportunities. We offer a suite of services such as on demand resources and networking to propel your career forward.
We’re a global organization, full of outstandingly dedicated people who aren’t afraid to think differently, challenge the status quo and take sensible risks along the way. You will enjoy pushing boundaries as we build innovative technology that helps clients, customers and employees live their best lives. You will have access to leadership and learning opportunities and the resources needed to take your career in any direction. We will help you do your best work, offering flexibility, while delivering on our Purpose.
What we offer you:* Market competitive base salaries, with a yearly bonus potential at every level
* Medical, dental, vision, life insurance, disability insurance, Paid Time Off (PTO), and leave of absences, such as parental and military leave
* Retirement plans:
* 401(k) plan with company match (up to 4%)
* Company-funded pension plan

* Work/Life Resources to help support topics such as parenting, housing, senior care, finances, pets, legal matters, education, emotional and mental health, and career development.
* Tuition Assistance to help finance traditional college enrollment toward obtaining an approved degree, many accredited certificate programs, and industry designations.

title: Director of Marketing
description:
We are excited to announce an incredible opportunity to lead our US marketing team as Director of Marketing at Comarch Inc . This role is ideal for a strategic thinker and agile leader ready to shape and execute innovative marketing initiatives in a US market. Seize this chance and apply today! The ideal candidate is a self-starter, proactive in setting the direction rather than waiting for it, and capable of navigating complex, multi-regional environments with strong leadership and B2B marketing expertise.
### **Candidate profile**

* Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business Administration, or a related field. MBA or advanced degree preferred
* Minimum of 7-10 years of experience in marketing, with at least 5 years in a leadership role
* Proven track record of successful marketing strategy development and execution in a B2B environment
* Strong strategic thinking and analytical skills, with the ability to translate data into actionable insights
* Excellent leadership and team management abilities, with a collaborative and results-driven approach
* Proficiency in digital marketing tools and platforms, including SEO, SEM, email marketing, HubSpot, ZoomInfo, and social media are required
* Experience in managing marketing budgets and optimizing ROI

### **Your responsibilities**

Strategic Planning and Execution


* Develop and implement the marketing strategy for Comarch USA and Canada, aligning with the company’s overall business objectives
* Identify key market opportunities and challenges, creating targeted, data-driven marketing campaigns with the team that are goal-oriented and focused on clear KPIs and measurable outcomes
* Manage overall strategy for integrated marketing campaigns across multiple channels, including digital, social media, events, and collateral, ensuring all initiatives are driven by data and aligned with defined objectives

Team Leadership and Management


* Lead, manage, and mentor the USA marketing team, providing guidance and support to drive high performance and professional growth
* Manage staff focused on Product Marketing and other Marketing Specialists
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams including Sales, Consultants, Operations, Finance, Human Resources, and more to ensure alignment and support of marketing objectives.
Create clear Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) for all critical processes in cooperation with HQ and develop comprehensive onboarding materials to expedite new team members' integration and effectiveness  
* 

  

Lead Generation and Demand Generation


* Manage lead generation campaign strategies to support sales and business development efforts, ensuring every initiative is intentional and targeted with clear goals
* Ensure Product Marketing Managers focus not only on acquiring net new clients but also on launching marketing programs aimed at growing existing accounts and deepening client relationships
Monitor and analyze campaign performance, optimizing strategies to improve lead quality and conversion rates, especially within the constraints of limited marketing tools and automation  
* 

  

Budget Management


* Develop and manage the marketing budget, ensuring efficient allocation of resources and maximizing ROI
* Every dollar spent must be intentional and focused on achieving specific, measurable outcomes
* Monitor expenditures and provide regular reports on budget performance and campaign effectiveness
* Partnerships, Networking, and Events
* Build and maintain relationships with key industry partners and media outlets.
* Oversee the marketing strategies and teams for all events, conferences, and tradeshows in the USA and Canada

Brand Management


* Ensure consistent brand messaging and positioning across all marketing materials and platforms
* Manage and enhance Comarch’s brand presence in the North American market through strategic brand initiatives and positioning

### **For you**

  

Salary range information below reflects target base salary. Some positions may have an opportunity to receive an additional bonuses based on company discretions and contingent on individual performance. Actual compensation will be based on candidate’s experience, education, licensure requirements and/or skill level and will be finalized at the time of the offer.  

  

  

* Base Salary Range:$ 146,000.00 - $ 230,000.00/yr., actual pay will be based on relevant qualifications and experience
* 100% paid health insurance
* 401(k) match
* Flexible Spending Account (health, dependent, commuter)
* Wellness Reimbursement Program
* Exciting work in a rapidly growing department working with leading world brands
* Opportunity to learn from leading specialists to develop professional IT career
* Hybrid Work Model

### **Accommodation statement**

  

Comarch Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. We consider applicants without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital or veteran status, or any other category protected by federal, state, or local law. Comarch Inc provides reasonable accommodations to hires with disabilities on case-by-case basis.

description:

title: CFO
description:
Diamond Chemical Company, a leader in the cleaning and chemical solutions industry, is seeking an experienced Chief Financial Officer (CFO) to join our executive team in East Rutherford, NJ. We are looking for a strategic financial leader with a robust background in mergers and acquisitions (M&A), private equity, and senior-level financial leadership.

Position Overview:

The CFO will be a key member of our executive team, responsible for leading the financial strategy, overseeing M&A activities, and managing relationships with private equity investors. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of success in financial leadership roles, including experience as a CFO and Senior Vice President (SVP) in finance.

Key Qualifications:

* Mergers & Acquisitions Expertise: Extensive experience leading M&A transactions and driving value creation.
* Leadership Experience: Minimum of 5 years in a CFO or Senior Vice President (SVP) role in finance.
* Private Equity Experience: Strong familiarity with private equity-backed companies, financial reporting, and capital structure management.
* Strategic thinker with excellent financial acumen, communication skills, and the ability to influence at the highest levels.

Primary Responsibilities:

* Lead the company’s financial strategy, including budgeting, forecasting, and financial planning.
* Drive M&A initiatives, from identifying opportunities to integrating acquisitions seamlessly.
* Oversee financial reporting, compliance, and risk management.
* Collaborate with private equity investors to align financial objectives and maximize value.
* Develop strategies to enhance financial performance and support the company’s growth objectives.

Why Work with Us?

Diamond Chemical Company offers a dynamic and innovative work environment where you can drive meaningful change and growth. As a key decision-maker, you’ll have the opportunity to shape the financial future of a well-established and respected company.

Interested candidates should submit their resume.

Join us and take on a pivotal role in our growth journey while advancing your career in a leading chemical company.

title: Workers' Compensation Attorney
description:
Experienced Workers' Compensation Attorney - NY Bar:  

  

Are you sick of only handling one aspect of a claim? Tired of handing off a case to someone else after crushing a deposition? LOIS' defense strategy will allow you to take ownership of a claim. You will work directly with clients on their claims from filing to closure. There is no better feeling than being responsible for a good outcome on a claim and LOIS is the place where we celebrate that!

  


Base pay range **$110,000 - $140,000, depending on experience**

  

  

Working at Lois means finding the place you can succeed, grow, and be part of a constantly advancing firm that has been breaking barriers and becoming a highly recognized name in the industry! With a team-mentality, full-benefits package, continuous on-going support, and strong standards of development, we continue to be leaders with consistently positive outcomes. Come meet with us to see what we are all about and let's break barriers so we can help our clients, together!

  


Work-life balance and career growth are fundamental priorities. We are devoted to helping the community which starts with our passion for helping to defend our clients. We strive to build strong, responsive relationships while being ethically responsible and formidable allies. We provide on-going education programs for all levels of employment, from legal assistants to partners. By combining our community driven culture and our on-going education, we cultivate an atmosphere of thought-provoking advocacy for everyone.

  


***Why be an Attorney at Lois?***


* Flexible work from home schedule
* Our creative approach to case handling
* We consistently apply firm standards and tactics to achieve client goals
* Positive relationships with our clients built on our unwavering advocacy
* We are tenacious litigators in and out of the court room
* Continued education to help foster professional and personal growth
* Our cradle-to-grave file handling sets us apart as industry leaders
* A well-rounded work-life balance
* Our four core values (Creativity, Aggressiveness, Professionalism and Service) help our Team Members create powerful results for our clients!

**Qualifications:**

  

* Juris Doctor (J.D.) degree from an accredited law school.
* Admission to the New York Bar in good standing.
* FIVE (5) years of experience in workers' compensation defense

title: Weekend Dispatcher
description:
**About DH2 Chauffeured Transportation:** DH2 Chauffeured Transportation is a leading provider of premium transportation services, committed to delivering unparalleled professionalism and exceptional customer service. With a "client-first" approach and a dedication to leveraging cutting-edge technology, we strive to exceed our clients' expectations and ensure a seamless travel experience. As a certified MWBE (Minority Women Business Enterprise) company, we prioritize Diversity and Inclusion in every aspect of our operations.

**Position: Weekend Dispatcher**

**Responsibilities:**

* Dispatch Operations: Coordinate and manage transportation logistics to ensure timely and efficient delivery of services.
* Communication: Efficiently communicate with drivers and clients, ensuring clear and professional interactions.
* Problem Resolution: Handle issues or emergencies during overnight shifts, implementing effective solutions while prioritizing client satisfaction and safety.
* Technology Utilization: Utilize GPS, dispatching software, and communication tools to optimize operations.
* Quality Assurance: Maintain high standards of service quality and professionalism.
* Documentation: Keep accurate records of dispatch activities, including reservations, vehicle assignments, client communications, and incident reports.
* Team Collaboration: Work with other dispatch team members and various departments to streamline processes, share best practices, and contribute to DH2's overall success.
* Monitoring: Monitor driver logs and keep detailed records.

**Requirements:**

* Proven experience in dispatching or a related field, preferably within the transportation industry.
* Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to interact professionally with clients, chauffeurs, and team members.
* Strong problem-solving abilities and the capacity to remain calm and composed in high-pressure situations.
* Proficiency in using dispatch software and other technology tools to optimize operations and enhance efficiency.
* Detail-oriented mindset with a commitment to upholding the highest standards of professionalism and customer service.
* Flexibility to work Saturday and Sunday, including weekends and holidays, as required by operational needs.
* Bilingual in Spanish and English is a must.
* High School Diploma or G.E.D.
* Must be at least 25 years old.
* At least 5 years of dispatching experience.
* Knowledgeable of the Tri-State Area and all airports.
* Ability to schedule and manage drivers' schedules.
* Core Values: Committed, dependable, team player, professional, determined, integrity, and authentic.

**We Offer:**

* Paid Training
* 401k
* Competitive Starting Hourly Rate: $22 - $25
* Part-Time Position
* Morning Shift
* Paid Time Off

**Join Our Team:** Be part of a dynamic organization that values teamwork, efficiency, and customer satisfaction. Apply now to start your career in transportation logistics! Submit your resume to stephanie@dh2limo.com or visit our website dh2limo.com/careers.

title: RN Field Nurse - Will Train New Grads!
description:
**Large Growing Certified Home Health Agency (CHHA) is seeking an RN on a full time basis to visit patients in Suffolk County only. Will Train New Grads!**

**Great opportunity for RN who enjoys the autonomy and flexibility of being in the field.** 

**Responsibilities:**

* Assesses the patient/family situation for nursing and health related problems.
* Provides nursing care to patients requiring part time or intermittent professional nursing care at home.
* Develops and coordinates the plan of care specific to the needs of individual patients in conjunction with all health team members.
* Instructs and supervise patients, caregivers, LPNs, and home health aides in aspects of patient care as appropriate.
* Reports significant conditions/symptoms to the patient’s physician and modifies the plan of care accordingly.
* Initiates appropriate preventive and rehabilitative nursing procedures.
* Educates the patient/family regarding the disease process, self care techniques and prevention strategies.
* Evaluates the effectiveness and outcomes of care.
* Consults with and refers to other professionals or agencies in the community concerning patient needs
* Interprets to patient/families Agency policies, procedures and federal/state/local laws and regulations affecting service or entitlements.
* Documents, on a timely basis, all nursing service provided to patients as well as periodic reports to coordinate care and remain in compliance with state/federal regulations.
* Systematically plans for discharge from service.
* Effectively manages document flow and confidentiality of patient records as per Agency policy.
* Demonstrates a knowledge of and adherence to agency policy as well as state/federal regulations governing home care service.
* Participates in program evaluation, research, educational programs and other agency activities as appropriate.
* Maintains sufficient service productivity to meet agency goals and objectives.
* Participates in activities to enhance professional growth.
* Participates in the orientation of new staff.
* Participates in the student nurse program as assigned.
* Performs other duties as assigned.
* Oasis experience preferred

**Qualifications:**

* License and current registration to practice as a Registered Professional Nurse in the State of New York.
* Minimum of 1 to 2 years experience as a registered nurse in either Medical/Surgical nursing or home care
* Ability to assess and respond to the needs of patients and families in the home setting.
* Professional Liability Insurance
* Able to drive with automobile in good working order and available for use in the field.
* Ability to master basic computer skills.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $45.00 - $48.00 per hour

Work Location: On the road

title: Nurse Practitioner
description:
We are a Traumatic Brain Injury Center with offices in Elmhurst, Brooklyn Heights and Manhattan. We are looking for a Licensed Nurse Practitioner, preferably but not necessary bilingual **English/Spanish** to join our growing team of medical professionals in the **Brooklyn Center**. Your duties will include recording patients' medical histories, performing physical exams, administering diagnostic tests, and creating patient care plans. You will also administer treatment and observe patients' functioning over time. **This is an In-Person position, full time position**.

To be successful as a nurse practitioner, you should be empathic but resolute in your decision-making, and attentive to detail. Ultimately, a top-notch nurse practitioner will exhibit cultural competence and exceptional teamwork skills. If you are a Family Nurse Practitioner, please apply!

Nurse Practitioner Responsibilities:

* Performing physical exams and patient observations.
* Recording patients' medical histories and symptoms.
* Creating patient care plans and contributing to existing ones.
* Ordering, administering, and analyzing diagnostic tests.
* Monitoring and operating medical equipment.
* Diagnosing health issues.
* Administering medicine and other treatments.
* Detecting changes in patients' health and modifying treatment plans, as needed.
* Consulting with healthcare professionals and families.
* Training patients and their families to manage and prevent illness and injury.

Nurse Practitioner Requirements:

* Masters degree from an accredited nursing program.
* RN licensure in New York State and board-certified by either ANCC or AANP.
* APN authorization in the state of New York to practice in family health by the Board of Nurse Examiners.
* Prescriptive authorization.
* Experience providing primary care as a family nurse practitioner.
* Proficiency with medical instruments and equipment required to perform your work.
* Knowledge of computer-based data management programs and information systems, as well as medical records and point-of-interview technology.
* A sound understanding of all pertinent federal and state regulations, including HIPAA and OSHA.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills both in English and Spanish.
* Knowledge of disease prevention.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $130,000.00 - $140,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k) matching
* Flexible schedule
* Malpractice insurance

Medical Specialty:

* Neurology

* Yearly bonus

* Certified Nurse Practitioner (Required)

title: Litigation Attorney
description:
Litigation Attorney: NY Bar  

  

Has your legal career become stagnant? Do you need a place to constantly learn, grow, and advance? LOIS is the answer. Our number one goal is to train, support, and grow the careers of our employees. We provide a unique, enjoyable atmosphere where we allow everyone to contribute to the growth of our Firm while providing top of the line service to our clients. There is no other place for you like LOIS. Working at Lois means finding the place you can succeed, grow, and be part of a constantly advancing firm that has been breaking barriers and becoming a highly recognized name in the industry! With a team-mentality, full-benefits package, continuous on-going support, and strong standards of development, we continue to be leaders with consistently positive outcomes. Come meet with us to see what we are all about and let's break barriers so we can help our clients, together!

  


Work-life balance and career growth are fundamental priorities. We are devoted to helping the community which starts with our passion for helping to defend our clients. We strive to build strong, responsive relationships while being ethically responsible and formidable allies. We provide on-going education programs for all levels of employment, from legal assistants to partners. By combining our community driven culture and our on-going education, we cultivate an atmosphere of thought-provoking advocacy for everyone.

  


**Why be an Attorney at Lois:**


* Flexible work from home schedule
* Our creative approach to case handling
* We consistently apply firm standards and tactic to achieve client goals
* Positive relationships with our clients built on our unwavering advocacy
* We are tenacious litigators in and out of the court room
* Continued education to help foster professional and personal growth
* Our cradle-to-grave file handling sets us apart as industry leaders
* Our four core values (Creativity, Advocacy, Professionalism and Service) help our Team Members create powerful results for our clients!


**Responsibilities:**

  

* Represent client interests at virtual hearings and telephonic depositions
* Counsel clients on emerging issues in litigated matters
* Prepare exposure analysis and conduct settlement negotiations
* Consistently apply firm standards and tactics to achieve client goals


**Perks:**

  

* Firm provides 80% coverage of medical, dental and vision benefit costs
* 3% non-elective safe harbor contribution to 401K
* Life insurance and long-term disability provided at no cost to our Team Members
* Flexible work from home opportunities
* Hands-on training approach and continual education opportunities
* Continuing Legal Education at no cost to our Team Members
* Receive all of your CLE credits for the year during in-firm training

title: HEAD OF GLOBAL KOL MANAGEMENT AND ACADEMIC AFFAIRS, GLOBAL MEDICAL AFFAIRS
description:
States considered:
Role Description
The Head of Global KOL (Key Opinion Leader) Management and Academic Affairs will play a pivotal role in shaping and executing our engagement strategy with key opinion leaders and academic institutions across geographies and all species. This position requires a dynamic leader with a deep understanding of the veterinary pharmaceutical industry, clinical research and veterinary academia with strong relationship-building skills, and a passion for advancing our business through collaboration and education.
Position responsibilities:* Develop and implement a comprehensive KOL engagement strategy to enhance the company’s reputation and influence within the veterinary community.
* Develop and maintain a global platform for KOL management for the entire company across species.
* Identify, cultivate, and maintain relationships with key opinion leaders, including veterinarians, researchers, and industry experts.
* Coordinate and manage KOL activities, including advisory boards, speaker programs, and scientific collaborations.
* Monitor and analyze KOL feedback to inform product development, marketing strategies, and educational initiatives.
* University Affairs:
	+ Establish and strengthen partnerships with veterinary schools, universities, and research institutions globally, incorporating the current US focused team and expanding globally.
	+ Collaborate with academic institutions to support research projects, clinical trials, and educational programs.
	+ Represent the company at academic conferences, seminars, and industry events to promote our products and initiatives.
	+ Develop and manage scholarship programs, internships, and other educational opportunities for veterinary students


Qualifications:* Advanced degree in Veterinary Medicine, Animal Science, or a related field.
* Minimum of 10 years of experience in the veterinary industry, with a focus on KOL management and academic partnerships.
* Proven track record of building and maintaining relationships with key opinion leaders and academic institutions.
* Strong leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to travel domestically and internationally as required.

The ideal Nordstrom Rack team member enjoys working in a fast-pace, high-energy environment.

* Create a smooth fitting room experience by greeting customers and taking them to their fitting rooms, then sorting and returning clothing to the floor

title: Mortgage Occupancy Field Inspector
description:
GIS Field Services, Inc. has been in the mortgage field inspection industry for over 20 years and is based out of Dallas, TX. We are looking to hire Mortgage Occupancy Field Inspectors to perform residential property inspections on behalf of mortgage lenders. Our independent contractors enjoy a flexible schedule while earning weekly pay. Please visit our website to learn more about us and the industry. www.gisfieldservices.com
  
  

**Job Title:**  

Mortgage Occupancy Field Inspector
  
  

**County Coverage:**  

Queens
  
  

**Inspection Vol. per Month:**  

240
  
  

**Preferred Experience:****We are looking for knowledgeable and experienced inspectors:**  

* Aspen Grove ABC#
* Have used at least one of the industry standard smart phone apps: InspectorADE (what GIS uses), EZ Inspections or SafeView inspect
* Currently conducting occupancy inspections (or have in the past)


**Mortgage Property Inspection Overview:**  

Mortgage lenders require periodic updates on the properties they have financial interest in. The lender contracts with GIS to have inspectors go out to verify the property occupancy, report general property conditions, letter delivery/posting, vacant interior walkthrough or insurance repair progress report. Majority of our inspections are basic exteriors where some do require contact by door knock or letter delivery. In addition, there will be some inspections which require interior access to secured/vacant properties and appointment based insurance loss inspections.
  
  

**Job Responsibilities:**  

* Requires being able to spend extended periods of time driving
* Efficient time management to route and complete inspections with an estimated 3-5 day turnaround time in your agreed territory
* Make a determination of occupancy based on industry standards and report general property conditions
* Using a mobile app to obtain all photographs, comments, and form documentation
* Consistent communication with your inspection manager via text, email and phone


**Requirements:**  

* Valid US drivers license
* Aspen Grove ABC #
* Computer with an internet connection
* Fuel efficient vehicle
* iPhone or Android
* Printer
* Office supplies (paper, envelopes, ink)
* HUD keys (set of 11)
* Daylight hour availability
* Volt stick (preferred)


**Pay and Hours:**  

* Set rate per inspection is estimated at $15-$20+ per hour based on the number of inspections performed
* \\*\\*This will vary depending on location, volume and efficiency.\\*\\*
* Inspections are paid out every Friday by direct deposit for work completed the prior week
* Depending on the territory you should expect to work 5-15+ hours per week
* The job is a 1099 Independent Contractor position
company_description: GIS Field Services was founded in 1998. We provide mortgage occupancy and loss mitigation inspection services. We have full state coverage in AL, AR, DC, LA, TN, TX and we are currently expanding.

**Position Summary:** The KITH- Treats Counter Associate is the face of the KITH Treats shop. They are personable, friendly, and focused on delivering a first in class experience to all new and returning KITH-Treats customers. They are passionate about desserts and committed to delivering a best-in-class experience capped off with a beautifully assembled TREAT!

**RESPONSIBILITIES**

**Special Projects:**

**WHO YOU ARE**

* Detail oriented

* A charismatic people person

**WHO WE ARE**

Established in 2011, Kith is a leading lifestyle brand and progressive retail concept that’s celebrated globally for its ability to tell stories, evoke nostalgia, and connect product to the passion it’s woven with. Now in its eleventh year of business, Kith has in-house apparel lines for men, women and children, an ice cream parlor in every flagship, a full-service restaurant, and a retail footprint in three continents.

Born and raised in Queens, New York, Kith Founder Ronnie Fieg rose the ranks from 13-year-old stock boy at footwear franchise David Z. to the company’s chief buyer, earning him a profound understanding of the retail landscape and a network of powerful brand relationships. As the brand’s CEO and Creative Director, Fieg is known for his ability to create premium products and deliver unparalleled experiences, with a personal philosophy of giving the consumer more than what they pay for. Using Kith as a vehicle, Fieg has applied his signature lens to an impressive list of collaborators, including Coca-Cola, Nike, Versace, BMW, and many others.

An individual responsible for the generation of referrals and coordination of marketing and education activities with nursing facilities; assisted living facilities; physicians and other community agencies.

Previous sales/marketing experience, preferably in a hospice or other subset of healthcare. Excellent social and interpersonal skills and knowledge of hospice philosophy. Computer skills are also required.
